channel.title: git on Daddy's data analysis by Kazu Nozue
channel.description: Recent content in git on Daddy's data analysis by Kazu Nozue

item.title: Interactive app for time-course data of your kids' meet scores
item.description: Shiny package in R language can create a fantastic application in interactive mode using a browser (for free!). In an example below, you can download data file for four years of figure records in US junior olympics of synchronized swimming (public available data from USA synchro web site, compiled by Kazu Nozue). Using search box, you can narrow data down using any words found in any columns in data, such

item.title: Merging two branches in Git
item.description: Do you have branches in your git and want to merge them? How to merge two branches? Here is a simple example using RStudio. Initial commit. (“1st commit”) 2nd commit (“koi no yokan”) 3rd commit (“Tsuki ni nureta futari”) 4th commit (“Mayonaka Sugi no koi”) Making branch1 Commit on branch1 (“Jirettai”) Move to master and 5th commit on 1st line (“Wine red”)
